quote.text: Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent and original manner possible.

desc: I am an aspiring applied mathematician
currently searching for the work environment that
fits me best.
I love harmonic analysis and probability theory
and use them as tools to unravel
the myths of deep learning and
to invent new mathematically sound
ML/DL methods.
I wrote two theses (MSc and honors college)
on the phenomena of
benign overfitting and double descent
via kernel methods as a potent study proxy
for neural nets and on their own right.
Particular focus was on Sobolev kernels.
Strong subjects: High-Dimensional Probability Theory, Stochastic Processes, Representation Theory, Machine and Deep Learning
Teaching assistant for Analysis (in Italian)
Thesis: High-capacity hypothesis spaces in modern statistical learning (April 2023, PDF). Supervised by Prof. E. De Vito.
Participated in reading groups on neural differential equations and the COLT 2023 papers.
Participated in summer school Applied Harmonic Analysis and Machine Learning.
Thesis: Sobolev reproducing kernels on compact Lie groups (November 2023, PDF). Supervised by Prof. E. De Vito.
Strong subjects: Machine and Deep Learning (final project: Normalizing Flows, slides), Mis- and Disinformation
Thesis: Analytic combinatorics: Generating functions in algebra and geometry (May 2020). Supervised by Prof. M. Baake and Prof. C. Voll.
Teaching assistant for various courses in Linear Algebra and Analysis.
I am also a capable, self-taught
software developer
with strong senses for clean code
and hardware efficiency.
My main tools of trade are C, C++ and Python with
their respective ecosystems.
I have professional experiences
in GPU and graphics programming
(especially for synthetic data generation),
academic experiences in machine and
deep learning experimentation,
and hobby experiences in many other areas.
We are scaling up the results of the internship now.
Developed a pipeline of efficient tools for mass synthesization of realistic satellite imagery of whales in the ocean.
Held a talk in July 2023 presenting my work to the whole company.
